title: 112_hr3755
content: The Act may be cited as the "Freedom to Mourn in Peace Act of 2011". Congress finds that the sacrifices made by men and women in defending the freedoms guaranteed by the Constitution deserve respect and recognition. It is important for the families of fallen soldiers to have a peaceful space to mourn and find solace in knowing their loved ones made a significant sacrifice for freedom. Reasonable restrictions may be necessary to ensure this moment of peace, reflection, and healing. Funerals, memorial services, and bereavement ceremonies deserve special respect for the deceased and consideration for the emotional well-being of the bereaved. Restrictions are needed to prevent public demonstrations that exploit these private gatherings for attention and cause unnecessary emotional pain to the families and friends of the deceased veteran. The First Amendment protects public debate but also respects the need for loved ones to mourn in peace. Prohibition on demonstrations near funerals, memorials, and ceremonies for veterans. Prohibition on demonstrations near funerals, memorials, and ceremonies for veterans. Section 2413 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to prohibit demonstrations at veteran funerals without approval and within 150 feet of the funeral site. The amended section 2413 of title 38, United States Code prohibits demonstrations near funerals, memorials, and ceremonies for veterans. It includes restrictions on noise or disturbances within 1,000 feet of the cemetery or property where the funeral is held. Signs must be posted at the specified distance to notify of the funeral. Definitions are provided for clarity. The amended section 2413 of title 38, United States Code prohibits demonstrations near funerals, memorials, and ceremonies for veterans. Definitions are provided for clarity, including what constitutes a demonstration and a funeral. The table of sections in the chapter is amended by replacing the item for section 2413 with a new item. Prohibition on demonstrations at veteran funerals.
